title: >>> The PRACTICE Round
body_text:
Fly like a butterfly, sting like a bee ... bee-ball. Welcome to the pre-game showdown ...
DODGEBALL 74 Records
> Attendance: 18
> Biggest Return: Joey Smalls (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LXV)
> New Players: (None)
- This was the first event to feature not one bulletball. In preparation for the Toms River Tournament on February 3, DODGEBALL 74 was an all-painball* event. (*The Bee-ball was also put into play).
- DODGEBALL 74 featured
Prison Ball
.
- DODGEBALL 74 was headlined by a rematch from DODGEBALL LXV:
Sascha Basista vs. Joey Smalls
. Dodging expert Joey Smalls tied the series at 1 apiece defeating Sascha at 74.!
- A standing ovation for Luke: free pizza!
- DODGEBALL 74 was the eleventh consecutive
Dark Dodgeball
event.
Sascha Basista vs. Joey Smalls II
Dodging experts, intense wildmen, call them what you will ... they set the tempo at DODGEBALL 74. It was more than just a simple rematch.
The legends came out for this one as the forthcoming tourny has everyone on the edge of their seats. Rather than continue with the traditional bulletball battles, what better to prepare for the "Dover Takeover" than with an all-painball war!
An all-around performance by Tom Adams and titans like Lauren Winston and Lauren Stopa effortlessly trying to free their partners from prison will forever be remembered.
Joey Smalls picked up the revengeful win, 6 - 5.
"The painballs were a lot of fun; a nice change from bulletballs. It just seemed a lot less serious, just more pure fun. ... Everyone was all smiles the whole time ..."
-
TOM ADAMS
Tom hit the nail right on the head: DODGEBALL 74 may have been the most pure fun in quite sometime. The painballs added a new element of skill and risk certainly needed to win this coming Saturday night. Are the warriors ready for Dover?
Would you like to participate in an all-painball event?
YES! This first one rocked!
NO. It was fun, but I prefer bulletballs.
As long as I get to play, it really DOESN'T MATTER.
Free polls from Pollhost.com
TOMS RIVER TOURNAMENT
Saturday, February 3, 2007
Toms River High School East.
5pm
Approxiamately 30 teams may be registered. Will either of OUR two dodgeball squads be victorious?
DODGEBALL 75
Saturday, February 10, 2007
Wall High School
6:30pm
It's the rematch of the century ...
Chris Adams vs. Kevin Fitzpatrick
in the first-ever
Pick Your Poison
match.
What a year already, and it's only the end of January!
body_html:
Fly like a butterfly, sting like a bee ... bee-ball. Welcome to the pre-game showdown ...


DODGEBALL 74 Records
> Attendance: 18
> Biggest Return: Joey Smalls (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LXV)
> New Players: (None)

- This was the first event to feature not one bulletball. In preparation for the Toms River Tournament on February 3, DODGEBALL 74 was an all-painball* event. (*The Bee-ball was also put into play).
- DODGEBALL 74 featured Prison Ball.
- DODGEBALL 74 was headlined by a rematch from DODGEBALL LXV: Sascha Basista vs. Joey Smalls. Dodging expert Joey Smalls tied the series at 1 apiece defeating Sascha at 74.!
- A standing ovation for Luke: free pizza!
- DODGEBALL 74 was the eleventh consecutive Dark Dodgeball event.

Sascha Basista vs. Joey Smalls II
Dodging experts, intense wildmen, call them what you will ... they set the tempo at DODGEBALL 74. It was more than just a simple rematch.

The legends came out for this one as the forthcoming tourny has everyone on the edge of their seats. Rather than continue with the traditional bulletball battles, what better to prepare for the "Dover Takeover" than with an all-painball war!

An all-around performance by Tom Adams and titans like Lauren Winston and Lauren Stopa effortlessly trying to free their partners from prison will forever be remembered.

Joey Smalls picked up the revengeful win, 6 - 5.

"The painballs were a lot of fun; a nice change from bulletballs. It just seemed a lot less serious, just more pure fun. ... Everyone was all smiles the whole time ..."
- TOM ADAMS

Tom hit the nail right on the head: DODGEBALL 74 may have been the most pure fun in quite sometime. The painballs added a new element of skill and risk certainly needed to win this coming Saturday night. Are the warriors ready for Dover?


Would you like to participate in an all-painball event?
YES! This first one rocked!
NO. It was fun, but I prefer bulletballs.
As long as I get to play, it really DOESN'T MATTER.
  
Free polls from Pollhost.com

TOMS RIVER TOURNAMENT
Saturday, February 3, 2007
Toms River High School East.
5pm

Approxiamately 30 teams may be registered. Will either of OUR two dodgeball squads be victorious?

DODGEBALL 75
Saturday, February 10, 2007
Wall High School
6:30pm

It's the rematch of the century ... Chris Adams vs. Kevin Fitzpatrick in the first-ever Pick Your Poison match.

What a year already, and it's only the end of January!
